title: Getting Started with Web Development
brief: Learn the fundamentals of web development including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript basics.
content:
Web development is an exciting journey that starts with understanding the three core technologies: HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

## HTML - The Structure
HTML (HyperText Markup Language) provides the structure for your web pages. It uses tags to define elements like headings, paragraphs, images, and links.

## CSS - The Styling
CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) handles the visual presentation of your HTML elements. You can control colors, fonts, layouts, and animations.

## JavaScript - The Interactivity
JavaScript brings your web pages to life with dynamic behavior, interactivity, and user engagement features.

## Getting Started
1. Set up a code editor like VS Code
2. Create your first HTML file
3. Add some basic styling with CSS
4. Add interactivity with JavaScript

Start with simple projects and gradually increase complexity as you learn more concepts.

title: Modern CSS Techniques
brief: Explore modern CSS features like Flexbox, Grid, and CSS Variables for responsive design.
content:
Modern CSS has evolved significantly, offering powerful layout systems and features that make responsive design easier than ever.

## CSS Flexbox
Flexbox is a one-dimensional layout system perfect for aligning items and distributing space within containers.

## CSS Grid
CSS Grid provides a two-dimensional layout system for complex web page layouts.

## CSS Variables
CSS variables (custom properties) allow you to define reusable values throughout your stylesheet.

## Responsive Design
Use media queries to create layouts that adapt to different screen sizes and devices.

## Best Practices
- Use semantic HTML
- Mobile-first approach
- Optimize for performance
- Test across multiple browsers

title: JavaScript ES6+ Features
brief: Master modern JavaScript features including arrow functions, destructuring, and async/await.
content:
ES6 (ECMAScript 2015) and subsequent versions introduced many powerful features that have transformed JavaScript development.

## Arrow Functions
Concise syntax for writing function expressions:
```javascript
const add = (a, b) => a + b;
```

## Template Literals
String interpolation with backticks:
```javascript
const greeting = `Hello, ${name}!`;
```

## Destructuring
Extract values from arrays and objects:
```javascript
const { name, age } = person;
```

## Async/Await
Clean syntax for handling asynchronous operations:
```javascript
const data = await fetchData();
```

## Modules
Organize code into reusable modules using import/export.

title: Git and GitHub Essentials
brief: Learn version control with Git and collaborate effectively using GitHub.
content:
Git is a distributed version control system that tracks changes in your code, while GitHub provides a platform for hosting Git repositories.

## Getting Started with Git
- Initialize a repository: `git init`
- Track changes: `git add .`
- Commit changes: `git commit -m "message"`

## Working with GitHub
- Create a repository on GitHub
- Push your code: `git push origin main`
- Pull changes: `git pull`

## Branching
- Create branches for new features
- Merge branches when complete
- Resolve conflicts collaboratively

## Best Practices
- Write clear commit messages
- Use branches for features
- Review code before merging
- Keep your repository organized
